content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's how you can do it :

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString; language="julia")
    codeblocks = []
    # Iterate through the lines of the Markdown document.
    for line in split(md, "\n")
        if startswith(line, "````$language") || startswith(line, "```$language")
            push!(codeblocks, "")  # Start a new code block with an empty string.
        elseif endswith(line, "```") && !isempty(codeblocks)
            pop!(codeblocks)  # Remove the last element (the ending fence).
        elseif !isempty(codeblocks)
            codeblocks[end] *= line * "\n"  # Concatenate with previous lines.
        end
    end

    # Join all code blocks together, separating them with a newline.
    return join(filter(!isempty, codeblocks), "\n")
end
```
